Package abalone.protocol

Interface ServerProtocol

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbaloneServer
    public interface ServerProtocol
    Functions that every server should support. These methods are used to construct the messages that are sent to the clients. Some are called directly by the server, some in response to a message by the client

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String handleGameStart​(java.lang.String[] playerNames)
      After a queue has enough players, a game is started and all that are part of it are notified: GAME_START + DELIMITER + player name 1 + ... + DELIMITER + player name n + EOC
      java.lang.String handleHello​(java.lang.String playerName, boolean chat, boolean challenge, boolean leaderboard)
      Answers the hello message from a connected client.
      java.lang.String handleJoin​(java.lang.String playerName, int gamesize)
      Places the given player inside the specified queue and returns a message indicating the queue and its size that the player is now part of.
      java.lang.String handlePlayerMove​(java.lang.String playerName)
      Once the client whose turn it is sends its move, all clients are notified of it: MOVE + next player's name + DELIMITER + move's player name + DELIMITER + marble 1 + ... + DELIMITER + marble n
      java.lang.String handleQueueSizeQuery()
      Returns a message that includes the current size of each queue.

    • Method Detail

      • handleHello

        java.lang.String handleHello​(java.lang.String playerName,
                             boolean chat,
                             boolean challenge,
                             boolean leaderboard)
        Answers the hello message from a connected client. A name for the player should be chosen (the given one if available). While the server now knows which functionality the client supports the same is not true the other way around, so this information has to be included in the returned message: HELLO + DELIMITER + chat support + DELIMITER + challenge support + DELIMITER + leaderboard support + DELIMITER + actual player name + EOC
        Parameters:
        playerName - The preferred name of the client
        chat - If the client supports chat functionality
        challenge - If the client supports the challenge
        leaderboard - If the client supports the leaderboard
        Returns:
        The message that is sent back to the client

      • handleJoin

        java.lang.String handleJoin​(java.lang.String playerName,
                            int gamesize)
        Places the given player inside the specified queue and returns a message indicating the queue and its size that the player is now part of. JOIN + DELIMITER + queue + DELIMITER + queue size + EOC
        Parameters:
        playerName - The player that wants to join a queue
        gamesize - The queue that the player wants to join
        Returns:
        The message that is sent back to the client

      • handleGameStart

        java.lang.String handleGameStart​(java.lang.String[] playerNames)
        After a queue has enough players, a game is started and all that are part of it are notified: GAME_START + DELIMITER + player name 1 + ... + DELIMITER + player name n + EOC
        Parameters:
        playerNames - The names of all players of the game that has just started
        Returns:
        The message that the clients are notified with

      • handlePlayerMove

        java.lang.String handlePlayerMove​(java.lang.String playerName)
        Once the client whose turn it is sends its move, all clients are notified of it: MOVE + next player's name + DELIMITER + move's player name + DELIMITER + marble 1 + ... + DELIMITER + marble n
        Parameters:
        playerName - The name of the player that should now send back a move
        Returns:
        The message that is sent back to the client

      • handleQueueSizeQuery

        java.lang.String handleQueueSizeQuery()
        Returns a message that includes the current size of each queue. It is called whenever a client requests it. QUEUE_SIZE + DELIMITER + queue2 size + DELIMITER + queue3 size+ DELIMITER +queue4 size + EOC
        Returns:
        The message that is sent back to the client
